article.headline: Buffalo 72, Liberty 66
article.story: AMHERST, N.Y. (AP) -- Eric Moore scored 19 points to lead Buffalo past Liberty 72-66 Monday night. Buffalo's Greg Gamble posted a double-double with 15 points and 15 rebounds, while Parnell Smith scored 13 points. Andy Robinson contributed 11 points for Buffalo (7-4). Dwight Brewington led Liberty (6-3) with 16 points, going 7-of-9 from the field. Larry Blair had 14 points and Alex McLean scored 11 points. Buffalo, playing its first game since throwing a scare into No. 2 Pittsburgh, started off poorly. The Bulls shot just 11-for-35 in the first half, and were 2-of-10 from the 3-point line. Liberty shot 42 percent for the first half and led 30-27 at halftime. But the Bulls dominated underneath, outrebounding Liberty 52-31. Vadim Fedotov contributed 10 rebounds. Buffalo shot 24-of-64 from the field for the game (37.5 percent) while Liberty was 28-of-65 (43.1 percent).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
